Thomas Piketty: 'Le Pen's RN has clearly positioned itself as the party of billionaires'
subhead: Having voted against the 'Zucman' wealth tax, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National now openly presents itself as a right-wing party on every level: It is nationalist, anti-immigrant, extractivist and hyper-capitalist.

Ukrainian soldiers' rotations on the front line are growing ever longer
subhead: The Cross of Military Merit, awarded by President Zelensky to two soldiers who held their position for 165 days, highlights the rising difficulty of rotating infantrymen under constant threat from Russian drones.

title: Four arrests made after disruptions at Israeli orchestra's concert in Paris
subhead: Despite heightened security measures, flares were smuggled into a concert of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra on Thursday, November 6. Three men and one woman have been taken into police custody.

title: Macron, in Mexico, is questioned about returning ancient codices held in France
subhead: French President Emmanuel Macron met with his Mexican counterpart, Claudia Sheinbaum, on Friday, to prepare for the bicentenary of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

title: Life after terror for France's most famous prosecutor
subhead: François Molins was the face of the fight against terrorism in France during the 2010s, after the country faced a wave of jihadist attacks. Ahead of the 10th anniversary of the November 13, 2015, attacks, Molins, now retired, continues to tirelessly defend democracy.

The American retirees who benefit from free French social security
subhead: Attracted by French universal health coverage, many Americans have chosen to settle in the country, where they are also exempt from paying income tax.

title: UK struggles to acknowledge far right's rise
subhead: The UK, which resisted the Nazis during World War II, long believed itself immune to radical ideologies. Yet the rising popularity of Nigel Farage's Reform UK party, which plans to massively deport immigrants, suggests otherwise.

title: Possible sale of 1,000 metric tons of Niger's uranium to Russia alarms France
subhead: Nigerien authorities are seeking to sell yellowcake uranium stockpiled at the Arlit site, formerly operated by the French company Orano, which was forced to halt its activities following the 2023 coup d'état.
